column5: this past saturday, my buddy Ron and I decided to go and try for some trout in a little lake off Eagle Lake.  this involved a trip up a creek that was more like a snake than a straight line. it took an hour and a half to get to the lake and in the process we managed to ding our prop a couple times and will require a touch up.  within 5 minutes we had our first trout in the boat, by the 10 minute mark we had 3 trout and in 20 minutes we were limited out . to make the trip worthwhile we decided we would stay for another hour and a half and practice catch and release. when the time was up we had released another 6 trout. it was one of the best trips i have ever had into that lake,
Nice!!   Gotta love when a little adventure pays off.
little bit of work (and a bit of prop damage) certainly paid off
Well that was a success! Were they shallow?
